intro: Clavija spathulata, commonly known as the broad-leaf clavija, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its broad, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in shaded, moist environments.
